name: df-diag
body: |- wceq(cdiag, cmpo(s0, s1, ccat, ccat, co(cop(cv(s0), cv(s1)), ccurf, co(cv(s0), c1stf, cv(s1)))))
bodyPretty: ⊢ DiagFunc =(s0 ∈ Cat, s1 ∈ Cat ↦(< s0, s1 >[curryF](s0[1stF]s1)))
comment: Define the diagonal functor, which is the functor ` C --> ( D Func C ) ` whose object part is ` x e. C |-> ( y e. D |-> x ) ` . The value of the functor at an object ` x ` is the constant functor which maps all objects in ` D ` to ` x ` and all morphisms to ` 1 ( x ) ` . The morphism part is a natural transformation between these functors, which takes ` f : x --> y ` to the natural transformation with every component equal to ` f ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-Jan-2017.)
